title: Indie Supernatural Horror Film 'It Feeds' Trailer Starring Ashley Greene
description: "Don't be scared... It's worse if you're afraid." Samuel Goldwyn Films has revealed an official trailer for It Feeds, an indie horror thriller from filmmaker Chad Archibald. This hasn't shown up at any festivals and will be out in April to watch including on VOD at home. Ashley Greene and Shawn Ashmore star in the harrowing story of a young girl who insists that a malevolent entity is feeding on her. Ewww. After a young girl bursts into their home psychiatry practice claiming a demonic entity is feeding on her, Jordan and her clairvoyant mother Cynthia must find a way to stop the force before the girl is taken completely... Will this entity consume her entirely?! Or will they figure out how to stop it. Is this another horror film about grief? The also cast includes Ellie O'Brien as Jordan, with Juno Rinaldi, Mark Taylor, and Julian Richings. This looks like yet another generic, dime-a-dozen horror VOD flicks. Not something to waste time watching. Here's the official trailer (+ posters) for Chad Archibald's horror film It Feeds, direct from YouTube: In this supernatural horror film, after a troubled young girl bursts into their home psychiatry practice claiming an entity is [â€¦]

text: TRAILERS by March 6, 2025Source: YouTube "Don't be scared... It's worse if you're afraid." Samuel Goldwyn Films has revealed an official trailer for It Feeds, an indie horror thriller from filmmaker Chad Archibald. This hasn't shown up at any festivals and will be out in April to watch including on VOD at home. Ashley Greene and Shawn Ashmore star in the harrowing story of a young girl who insists that a malevolent entity is feeding on her. Ewww. After a young girl bursts into their home psychiatry practice claiming a demonic entity is feeding on her, Jordan and her clairvoyant mother Cynthia must find a way to stop the force before the girl is taken completely... Will this entity consume her entirely?! Or will they figure out how to stop it. Is this another horror film about grief? The also cast includes Ellie O'Brien as Jordan, with Juno Rinaldi, Mark Taylor, and Julian Richings. This looks like yet another generic, dime-a-dozen horror VOD flicks. Not something to waste time watching. Here's the official trailer (+ posters) for Chad Archibald's horror film It Feeds, direct from YouTube: In this supernatural horror film, after a troubled young girl bursts into their home psychiatry practice claiming an entity is feeding on her. Jordan (Ellie O'Brien) and her clairvoyant mother Cynthia (Ashley Greene) must find a way to stop the evil force before the girl is consumed completely. It Feeds is written and directed by indie genre filmmaker Chad Archibald, director of the films Desperate Souls, Neverlost, Kill, The Drownsman, Ejecta, Bite, The Heretics, and I'll Take Your Dead previously, and episodes of "The Haunted Museum" series most recently. Produced by Cody Calahan, Chad Archibald, Evan Ottoni, Morris Chapdelaine, Doug Murray, and William Santor. Samuel Goldwyn Films debuts Achibald's It Feeds horror in select US theaters + on VOD starting April 18th, 2025 coming soon this spring. Anyone want to watch it? html:
TRAILERS

by
March 6, 2025
Source: YouTube

"Don't be scared... It's worse if you're afraid." Samuel Goldwyn Films has revealed an official trailer for It Feeds, an indie horror thriller from filmmaker Chad Archibald. This hasn't shown up at any festivals and will be out in April to watch including on VOD at home. Ashley Greene and Shawn Ashmore star in the harrowing story of a young girl who insists that a malevolent entity is feeding on her. Ewww. After a young girl bursts into their home psychiatry practice claiming a demonic entity is feeding on her, Jordan and her clairvoyant mother Cynthia must find a way to stop the force before the girl is taken completely... Will this entity consume her entirely?! Or will they figure out how to stop it. Is this another horror film about grief? The also cast includes Ellie O'Brien as Jordan, with Juno Rinaldi, Mark Taylor, and Julian Richings. This looks like yet another generic, dime-a-dozen horror VOD flicks. Not something to waste time watching.

Here's the official trailer (+ posters) for Chad Archibald's horror film It Feeds, direct from YouTube:

In this supernatural horror film, after a troubled young girl bursts into their home psychiatry practice claiming an entity is feeding on her. Jordan (Ellie O'Brien) and her clairvoyant mother Cynthia (Ashley Greene) must find a way to stop the evil force before the girl is consumed completely. It Feeds is written and directed by indie genre filmmaker Chad Archibald, director of the films Desperate Souls, Neverlost, Kill, The Drownsman, Ejecta, Bite, The Heretics, and I'll Take Your Dead previously, and episodes of "The Haunted Museum" series most recently. Produced by Cody Calahan, Chad Archibald, Evan Ottoni, Morris Chapdelaine, Doug Murray, and William Santor. Samuel Goldwyn Films debuts Achibald's It Feeds horror in select US theaters + on VOD starting April 18th, 2025 coming soon this spring. Anyone want to watch it?

Find more posts in: Horror, Indies, To Watch, Trailer
